DOC.brief_summary: Muscle fatigue muscle recovery exercise recent area research involve Low Level Laser Therapy ( LLLT ) many factor remain unknown , optimal dos , power application parameter , mechanisms action , effect long-term exercise long-term effect skeletal muscle recovery . The present research project aim assess effect long-term recovery LLLT skeletal muscle exercise identify optimal dose application LLLT . After define best dose application , recruit two group irradiate different power , 100mW 400mW order seek optimal parameter low level laser therapy performance . The investigator believe Low Level Laser Therapy delay physiological process muscle fatigue , reduce injury skeletal muscle microdamage arise physical effort accelerate muscle recovery exercise .
DOC.brief_title: Low Level Laser Therapy Muscle Fatigue Muscle Recovery
DOC.detailed_description: To achieve propose objective perform randomize , double-blinded , placebo-controlled trial , voluntary participation high-level soccer athlete . Participants receive application low level laser prior execution strenuous exercise . It use laser cluster 5 diode ( 810 nm , 200 mW diode ) different dos ( placebo , 2J , 6J , 10J ) power 200mW . In second step , optimal dose already define , use apply different power two experimental group , 100mW 400mW . The investigator analyse parameter related volunteer exercise performance ( torque peak / maximum voluntary contraction ) , delay onset muscle soreness , biochemical marker muscle damage ( CK LDH ) , inflammation ( interleukin 1 6 , alpha tumoral necrosis factor ) oxidative stress ( TBARS , CAT , SOD carbonylated protein ) . The analysis perform exercise protocol , 1 minute , 1 , 24 , 48 , 72 96 hour end exercise protocol part study .
DOC.criteria: professional soccer player age 18 35 year old ; present historical musculoskeletal injury region hip knee 2 month precede study ; make use pharmacological agent and/or nutritional supplement ; participate minimum frequency 80 % training team athletes experience musculoskeletal injury study ; athletes whatever reason training routine change respect rest team course study .
